result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.   Defendant to have no contact with victim Valarie Shiddell listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Darpeirreontae L Burt in court, in custody, with Attorney Laura P. Sette.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for review of competency (state's position).  State does not challenge doctor's findings.  Defense states they are not seeking a hearing on competency.  Court finds Defendant not competent to proceed based on findings by doctor, finding Defendant may attain competency with proper treatment.  Court orders Defendant to the department to be assessed for the Outpatient Restoration Program.  Court addresses bail.  Attorney Sette makes statements regarding bail modification.  State makes statements, takes no position.  Court modifies bail.  Review hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
(Orig.) ... for modification of bond. Filed by Atty Sette.

Defendant Darpeirreontae L Burt in court, in custody, with Attorney Laura P. Sette.   Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant agrees that he is not competent to proceed.  State has not had time to review report filed by Defense.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Darpeirreontae L Burt in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense Counsel requests order for competency pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an inpatient/outpatient basis within 15 days.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Defendant allowed phone call. Defendant had a competency done another file and this matter to tag along with his other file in Br. 4.  Hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
